topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Preparing the Network for Installation

body.p: Before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you are responsible for preparing the network for all installations.

li.p: Modifiy the /etc/network/interfaces file to the following (DHCP EXAMPLE):

codeblock.codeph:
# The loopback network interface auto lo iface lo inet loopback
#BR-CTL BRIDGE - UNTAGGED PXE NETWORK CIDR auto br-ctl allow-ovs br-ctl iface br-ctl inet static address 10.200.73.11 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.73.1 ovs_type OVSBridge ovs_ports em1
#Bring up interface online allow-br-ctl em1 iface em1 inet manual ovs_bridge br-ctl ovs_type OVSPort

li.p: Reboot the system using the following command:
Execute the ifconfig -a command to output OVS bridge details. If the bridge is not present, execute the following commands to restart the bridge:
Enable the br-ctl network that is used for associating with HLM VM
a. Create br-ctl.xml file like below. Ensure respective VLAN ID for CLM is used.

codeblock.codeph: virsh net-define br-ctl.xml virsh net-start br-ctl virsh net-autostart br-ctl virsh net-list should display default and br-ctl

li.p: c. Display information on the bridge:
The output should appear similar to the following example:

codeblock.codeph: Bridge br-ctl Port "em1" Interface "em1" Port br-ctl Interface br-ctl type: internal ovs_version: "2.0.2"

li.p: Make sure that you can connect to an external NTP server and check that you can connect to an external network after exporting the proxy.
